alert.note: Alert for Robeson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 10:01PM EDT until July 10 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast North Carolina and northeast South Carolina, including the following counties, in southeast North Carolina, Robeson. In northeast South Carolina, Darlington, Dillon, Florence, Marion and Marlboro. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1001 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is either ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Pockets of between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen within a 1 hour`s time. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Florence, Lumberton, Hartsville, Dillon, Darlington, Red Springs, Pembroke, Maxton, Timmonsville, St. Pauls, Latta, Rowland, Lamar, Quinby, Clio, Sellers, Minturn, Bingham, Little Rock and Dunbar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means that localized flooding is possible near small streams, creeks, and especially across poor drainage areas. Flooding is also possible at prone low-lying areas along roads, which can make driving hazardous. Stay away from flooded ditches and do not drive across any flooded roads.
